mp3player.desktopaudio

Interface Player

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPlayer

    public interface Player
    Player is the main interface to play back or obtain information about a MediaFile or MediaStream.

    One player is bound to one MediaFile or MediaStream which can never change during the player's lifetime.

    In order to start the player, the following steps are necessary:

    • The player must be prepared using prepare()
    • A stream to the sound card must be opened. To open a new channel use activate(AudioDevice).
    • To start playback use start().
    Author:
    Philipp Holl

    • Method Detail

      • getMediaFile

        MediaFile getMediaFile()
        Returns the MediaFile associated with this Player. Each player can only play one media during it's lifetime, which is defined during the player's creation. If the player was created from a MediaStream, this method returns null.
        Returns:
        the MediaFile associated with this Player
        See Also:
        getMediaStream()

      • getMediaStream

        MediaStream getMediaStream()
        Returns the MediaStream associated with this Player. Each player can only play one media during it's lifetime, which is defined during the player's creation. If the player was created from a MediaFile, this method returns null.
        Returns:
        the MediaStream associated with this Player
        See Also:
        getMediaFile()

      • prepare

        void prepare()
      throws UnsupportedMediaFormatException,
             java.io.IOException
        Loads the media so it can be played back without delay.

        This method blocks until the media is loaded. Weather the media is buffered completely or what steps are needed for playback depends on the implementing class. The method estimatePreparationDuration() gives an approximation of how long this method will take to complete.

        In the process, the format of the media will also become available, see getMediaFormat().

        Throws:
        UnsupportedMediaFormatException - if the media format is not supported
        java.io.IOException - if the media file cannot be read
        See Also:
        isPrepared(), estimatePreparationDuration(), getMediaFormat()

      • isPrepared

        boolean isPrepared()
        A player needs to be prepared in order to play audio or give format information. Usually prepare() must be called before playback can begin, although a player may not need preparation.
        Returns:
        true if the player is prepared
        See Also:
        prepare()

      • estimatePreparationDuration

        double estimatePreparationDuration()
                            throws UnsupportedMediaFormatException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Estimates the time it takes to prepare the given media using prepare(). This method may read file format information about the media object. If the media format is not already loaded, this method call can take some time to complete, usually under 100ms.
        Returns:
        the approximate time prepare() will take in seconds
        Throws:
        UnsupportedMediaFormatException - if the media format is not supported
        java.io.IOException - if the media file cannot be read
        See Also:
        prepare()

      • getMediaFormat

        MediaFormat getMediaFormat()
        If loaded, this method returns the MediaFormat of this player's media, otherwise null. The format might be loaded but is not required to by calling prepare(). To explicitly load the format, use loadMediaFormat().
        Returns:
        the MediaFormat or null if not loaded
        See Also:
        loadMediaFormat()

      • loadMediaFormat

        void loadMediaFormat()
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     UnsupportedMediaFormatException,
                     java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Both the methods getMediaFormat() and getMediaInfo() depend on the media format to be loaded. Often however, the format will also be loaded by prepare(). This method can be called either before or after prepare().
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the format cannot be read
        UnsupportedMediaFormatException - if the format is not supported
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the player is based on a MediaStream which does not contain format information

      • waitForDurationProperty

        void waitForDurationProperty()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                             java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits until the media duration is known. If the duration is already known, this method returns immediately.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the player is not prepared
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the duration will never be known. This could be because the player runs into an I/O error.

      • getMediaInfo

        MediaInfo getMediaInfo()

      • getEncodedFormat

        AudioDataFormat getEncodedFormat()

      • getDecodedFormat

        AudioDataFormat getDecodedFormat()

      • newEncodedStream

        MediaStream newEncodedStream()
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             UnsupportedMediaFormatException,
                             java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Creates a new MediaStream for this player's media starting at the given position. The stream will provide audio data as stored in the file without file format information. If the player is based on a MediaStream providing decoded data, this method will also return a decoded stream.

        Preparing the player is not required for this operation. If the media format is not known, it will be loaded by this method. The returned MediaStream will therefore know the MediaFormat returned by MediaStream.getMediaFormat().

        Returns:
        a new encoded MediaStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the media cannot be read
        UnsupportedMediaFormatException - if the format is not supported
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if streaming is not supported, see AudioEngine.isStreamingSupported() or the player is based on a MediaStream.
        See Also:
        newDecodedStream(double)

      • newDecodedStream

        MediaStream newDecodedStream(double startPosition)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             UnsupportedMediaFormatException,
                             java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                             java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Parameters:
        startPosition - the start position in seconds
        Returns:
        a new decoded MediaStream starting at the given position
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the media cannot be read
        UnsupportedMediaFormatException - if the format is not supported
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the player is not prepared
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if streaming is not supported

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        If a player is active, it has a line to itself and can start playing audio.

        A player deactivates itself after finishing playback if and only if another player was queued using setNext(Player). The deactivation can even happen before audio playback stops, because an internal buffer might still contain audio data of this player after it is deactivated.

        As many systems only have a limited amount of audio lines, players can be deactivated to free the resource for other players while keeping the media status and buffer. An approximate maximum of simulatenously active players can be obtained using AudioDevice.getMaxActivePlayers().

        Returns:
        the active status
        See Also:
        activate(AudioDevice), deactivate(), AudioDevice.getMaxActivePlayers()

      • activate

        void activate(AudioDevice device)
       throws AudioEngineException,
              java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Parameters:
        device - the device to play on
        Throws:
        AudioEngineException - if activating the media fails
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the player is not prepared

      • switchDevice

        void switchDevice(AudioDevice device)
           throws AudioEngineException,
                  java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This method blocks until playback on the new device has begun. Calling this method with the current device will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        device - the new device to play on
        Throws:
        AudioEngineException - if opening the given device causes an error
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the player is not active

      • canSetNext

        boolean canSetNext(Player next)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Tests if the audio data of the given player can be played through this player's channel. If true, setNext(Player) can be called with the other player.
        Parameters:
        next - a different player
        Returns:
        true if setNext(Player) can be called with the given player
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the other player's format is not known or it is not prepared
        See Also:
        setNext(Player)

      • setNext

        void setNext(Player next)
      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets a player to play directly after this one finishes, through this player's channel. The two audio data streams will be merged, so no delay between the two players can appear. The other player will start at it's current position.

        This can only be used under specific circumstances. Use canSetNext(Player) to see if the method is supported with a given player.

        If the given player is not prepared, an IllegalStateException is thrown. If for other reasons, canSetNext(Player) would return false, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        The other player needs to be deactivated when this player finishes. If it isn't, the behavious is unspecified.

        Pass this player as next to create an indefinite loop. The above limitation does not apply to this case.

        Parameters:
        next - the player to start after this one finishes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the other player is not prepared
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the other player cannot be set as next
        See Also:
        canSetNext(Player), getNext()

      • getNext

        Player getNext()

      • getAudioBuffer

        AudioBuffer getAudioBuffer()
        Returns a reference to the data buffer of this player. If direct access to the buffer is not supported by the implementing class, this method returns null.

        If supported, the buffer will be created during prepare(). Calling the method beforehand, will return null.

        Returns:
        a reference to the data buffer

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Releases all resources associated with this player and returns when the disposal is completed. This method will also deactivate() the player if it is still active.

      • start

        void start()
    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Starts playing this player's media. If the player is not active (isActive()), this method throws an IllegalStateException
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the player is not active

        void pause()

      • isPlaying

        boolean isPlaying()

        void addStateListener(PlayerEventListener l)

      • removeStateListener

        void removeStateListener(PlayerEventListener l)

      • getPosition

        double getPosition()
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns the current position in seconds. If the player is not prepared, this method returns -1.
        Returns:
        the current position in seconds
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no media is loaded

      • setPositionBlocking

        void setPositionBlocking(double position,
                         double timeout)
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Seeks the given position in the track, blocking until the current position has been updated.
        Parameters:
        position - the target position in seconds
        timeout - timeout in seconds
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if seeking is interrupted or in case of timeout
        java.io.IOException

      • setPositionAsync

        void setPositionAsync(double position)

      • getDuration

        double getDuration()
        Returns the media duration in seconds.

        If the duration is not known, this method returns -1. In this case, if buffer access is supported, AudioBuffer.getEndPosition() can be used to get the currently known minimum duration.

        Returns:
        the media duration in seconds

      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • getBalance

        double getBalance()
        Retrieves the left-right volume. -1 is only left speaker while 1 is only right speaker.
        Returns:
        the audio balance

      • setBalance

        void setBalance(double balance)
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
